title: Far West Community Associates: From Naples to Chicago—The Neopolitan Crèche at the Art Institute of Chicago
hero_caption: Crèche, mid–18th century. Naples, Italy. Restricted gifts of Mr. and Mrs. James N. Bay...
short_description: Community Associates holiday lecture and luncheon
description:
Join speaker Jeff Nigro, and explore the crèche, a spectacular array of over 200 figures celebrating the Nativity and a splendid legacy of the cultural richness of 18th-century Naples. Learn more about how the piece came to the Art Institute of Chicago.

Schedule of the Day
10:00 Coffee
10:30 Lecture
12:00 Lunch (Cash Bar)

Lunch menu choices: Seasoned pork chop with mashed potatoes, vegetable bundles, and chocolate lava cake for dessert. Please advise of any dietary restrictions.

Accessibility and Dietary Concerns
Community Associates try to make their events accessible to members. Please note that some programs may require standing for a period of time, walking on uneven terrain or using stairs without handrails. Programming occurs year-round, and specifications regarding mobility, medical, or dietary restrictions must be disclosed prior to registering for a program so that Community Associates can make their best effort to provide accommodation. Please contact the program chair of the event if you have any questions or concerns.

Program Capacity: 200
Registration Period: November 6, 2018–November 27, 2018

To contact the event planner, please reach out to Cheryl Groth at (630) 363-0947 or dwightgroth@sbcglobal.net. To contact the assistant event planner, please reach out to Laurie Hildebrand at (630) 234-3667 or laureen.hildebrand@att.net.

This Community Associates event is exclusively for current Community Associates members. Membership will be verified at the door, and refunds cannot be issued for those without a valid membership. For Community Associates events that allow guests, nonmember guests must be registered by a Community Associates member.

If you are interested in becoming a member of Community Associates, please visit artic.edu/joinnow to join both the Art Institute of Chicago and the Community Associates group of your choice.
location: St. Charles Country Club, 1250 Country Club Rd., St. Charles, IL 60174
buy_button_caption:
